intro: Aneilema rendlei, commonly known as the African violet, is a tropical plant native to central Africa. It is a member of the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its attractive, velvety leaves and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows as an herbaceous perennial, reaching heights of up to 30 centimeters. Its flowers come in a variety of colors, including purple, pink, and white, and are often used in ornamental gardening. Aneilema rendlei prefers bright, indirect light and well-draining soil to thrive.
